P(t) = 50cos((2pi)/29 * t) + 50. It takes 29 days for the Moon to go through its cycle of full moon, half moon, new moon, half moon, and then back to full moon. The function P models the percentage of the Moon that is visible r days after the cycle begins, where t = 0 corresponds to a full moon on the night of June 5, 2020. Based on the model, which of the following best describes how the percentage of the Moon that is visible is changing on the night of June 25, 2020?

options.a: It is increasing by 8.3% per day.
options.b: It is increasing by 10.1% per day.
options.c: It is increasing by 31.5% per day.
options.d: It is decreasing by 8.3% per day.
options.e: It is decreasing by 10.1% per day.

questions.question: A spherical balloon is being inflated so that the rate of change of its volume remains constant. The radius r inches, of the balloon is a function of time t, in seconds. When r = 2 inches, the radius of the balloon is increasing at the rate of 1 inch per second. At what rate, in inches per second, is the radius increasing when r = 3 inches? (The volume V of a sphere with radius r is V= 4/3 * pi * r ^ 3 .)
If F(x) = integrate e' * cos(t - 1) dt from 0 to x what is F' * (x)?
